TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit MemoryExtensions/TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides a handler used by the language compiler to format interpolated strings into character spans.

MemberSignature.Value: public TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler (int literalLength, int formattedCount, Span<char> destination, out bool shouldAppend);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 literalLength, int32 formattedCount, valuetype System.Span`1<char> destination, [out] bool& shouldAppend) cil managed
Public Sub New (literalLength As Integer, formattedCount As Integer, destination As Span(Of Char), ByRef shouldAppend As Boolean)
new MemoryExtensions.TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler : int * int * Span<char> * bool -> MemoryExtensions.TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler
public: TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler(int literalLength, int formattedCount, Span<char> destination, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] bool % shouldAppend);

Docs.param: The number of constant characters outside of interpolation expressions in the interpolated string.
The number of interpolation expressions in the interpolated string.
When this method returns, contains if the destination may be long enough to support the formatting, or if it won't be.
Docs.summary: Creates a handler used to write an interpolated string into a span of characters.
Docs.remarks: This is intended to be called only by compiler-generated code. Arguments are not validated as they'd otherwise be for members intended to be used directly.

MemberSignature.Value: public TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler (int literalLength, int formattedCount, Span<char> destination, IFormatProvider? provider, out bool shouldAppend);

new MemoryExtensions.TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler : int * int * Span<char> * IFormatProvider * bool -> MemoryExtensions.TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler
public: TryWriteInterpolatedStringHandler(int literalLength, int formattedCount, Span<char> destination, IFormatProvider ^ provider, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] bool % shouldAppend);

Docs.param: The number of constant characters outside of interpolation expressions in the interpolated string.
The number of interpolation expressions in the interpolated string.
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
When this method returns, contains if the destination may be long enough to support the formatting, or if it won't be.
Docs.summary: Creates a handler used to write an interpolated string into a span of characters.
Docs.remarks: This is intended to be called only by compiler-generated code. Arguments are not validated as they'd otherwise be for members intended to be used directly.
